gurmukhi: so kirho Ab hau suin rudR jU qo sMg bYn aucwrq hau ] bwhY ktI iqh BUl inhwr Ab haUhUM su kRoD invwrq hau ]
transliteration: So Kariho Ab Hau Soun(i) Rudra Joo To San Bain Ouchaarat Hau|| Baahai Katitih Bhool Nihaar Ab Haoohoon Su Krodh Nivaarat Hau||
translation: “O Shiva ! listen, I shall do it now; seeing his arms cut doen and his erratic behaviour, I relinquish my anger;

gurmukhi: pHlwd ko pOqR khwvq hY su iehY jIA mwih ibcwrq hau ] qw qy fMf hI dY kir Coir dXo ieh qy nih qwih sMGwrq hau ]2240]
transliteration: Prahlaad Ko Paoutra Kahaavat Hai Su Ihai Jeea Maah(i) Bichaarat Hau|| Taa Te Dand Hidai Kar(i) Chhodh(i) Dayo Eh Te Nah(i) Taah(i) Sanhaarat Hau||2240||
translation: “I also think that he is the son of Prahlad, therefore I release him after punishing him and do not kill him.”2240.

gurmukhi: XO bKSwie kY sXwm jU so qh BUp ko sXwm ky pwien fwro ] BUl kY BUpq kwm krXo Ab hy pRB jU qum kRoD invwro ]
transliteration: Yau Bakhshaae Kai Syaam Joo So Tah Bhoop Ko Syaam Ke Paain Daro|| Bhool Kai Bhoopat Kaam Daryo Ab He Prabh Joo Toum Krodh Nidaro||
translation: In this way, causing the king to accept his mistake, Shiva got him to fall at the feet of Krishna and said, “Sahasrabahu has committed a wrong act; O Lord! forsake your anger;

gurmukhi: pOqR ko bXwh kro ieh kI durqw sMg Aaur kCU n ibcwro ] XO kir bXwh sMg aUKh lY Anru`D ko sXwm jU Dwm isDwro ]2241]
transliteration: Paoutra Ko Byaah Daro Eh Kiduhtaa San Aur Kachhodh Na Bicdaro|| You Kar(i) Byaah San Ookhah Lai Anruddh Ko Syaan Joo Dhaam Siddaro||2241||
translation: “Now marry your son with his daughter without any thought and taking Usha and Aniruddh with you, go to your home.”2241.

gurmukhi: jo suin hY gun sXwm jU ky Pun Aaurn qy Aru Awpn gYhY ] Awpn jo pVhY pVvwie hY Aaur kib`qn bIc bnY hY ]
transliteration: Jo Soun(i) Hai Goun Syaam Joo Ke Phoun Auran Te Ar(u) Aapan Gadhai|| Oopan Jo Paadvaae Hai Aur Kabittan Beech Banai Hai||
translation: He, who will listen to the praises of Krishna from others and also sing himself; he, who will read about his virtues, and cause others to read the same and sing in verse;

gurmukhi: sovq jwgq Dwvq Dwm su sRI biRjnwiek kI suD lYhY ] soaU sdw kib sXwm BnY Pun Xw Bv BIqr Pyr n AYhY ]2242]
transliteration: Sovat Jaagad Dhaavat Dhaam Su Sribrijnaaik Kisudh Lai-hai|| Sooo Sadaa Kabi Syaam Bhanai Phoun Yaa Bhav Bheetar Pher Na Ai-hai||2242||
translation: He, who will remember him, while sleeping, waking and moving, he will never be born again in this ocean of Samsara.2242.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI dsm iskMD purwxy bicqR nwtky kiRSnwvqwry bnwsur ko jIq AnruD aUKw ko bXwh ilAwvq Bey ]
transliteration: It(i) Sridasam Sikandh Puraane Bachitra Naatke Krishnaavatdare Banaasur Ko Jeet Anrudh Ookhaa Ko Byaah Liaavvat Bhae||
translation: End of the description of conquering Banasura and marrying Aniruddh and Usha in Krishnavatara (based on Dasham Skandh Purana) in Bachittar Natak.

gurmukhi: AQ ifg rwjw ko auDwr kQnM ]
transliteration: Ath Dig Raaja Ko Udhaar Kathanan||
translation: Now begins the description of the salvation of the king Dig
